text: You know how sometimes fields end up showing the wrong thing but have the right default content (unmodified)?
usually, it's a text field and I add a space, remove a space, and click apply
but this time it's a repeating child element (default content is empty, min is null)
I can reset by adding one and then removing it and clicking apply
but is there a way to reset all of them at once? or to prevent this?

I too find this frustrating, it's happening to some repeaters where by default there is none and nothing should show but it adds random padding to my page, i've had to do extra loops and if statements to check if anything exists within the loop before printing the code to show the repeater items instead of just if it exists
from what I can tell, it looks like a default is required if you are using a repeater/group

Vote for this idea if you think it would be nice to have the ability to hide a section from the published page but retain the content in the editor. Often authors have 50% of the content and want to publish what they have. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Add-quot-Hide-Show-quot-Drag-and-Drop-Section-in-Pages/idi-p/459051#M87354>

<@UG7S8J18D> What do you think about being able to set sections in a published page as "drafts" instead? Maybe with different versions? I can imagine an initial version is good enough to publish and then work can start on the next version.

Hi <@UDHT6N5SM> yes draft is probably a better word. I ran into this scenario with an event with speakers and an agenda. These are often like building an airplane as it is taking off. Constant revisions but still need to be published.
<@U01JV10LWGZ> I think you might be interested in this ideaâ€”"drafts" feels like a good way of managing versions while not breaking a published page

If I explicitly add a module like this:
```{% block section %}
  {% module "section" path="/src/modules/section",
     label="Section",
     no_wrapper=True
  %}
{% endblock section %}```
the resulting html is clean without any outer wrapping div around the <section> tag (outermost element of the module)

_but_ when I add the module to a template in a dynamic dnd_area, e.g.
```{% dnd_area "sections" %}
{% end_dnd_area %}```
All the sections that are dynamically added have at least 4 wrapping divs around the section tag (div.row-fluid-wrapper > div.row-fluid > div.span12.widget-span > div.hs_cos_wrapper > section).

Is there any way to ensure that there are no wrapping divs around the modules added?
